alert.name: Diego Cells - Total Memory Available % alert

panels.description:
Percentage of remaining memory capacity for a given cell.

When to scale:
Total memory available should be greater than 10-20% otherwise scale up
panels.title: Diego Cells - Total Memory Available %

alert.name: Diego Cells - Total Disk Available % alert

panels.description:
Percentage of remaining disk capacity for a given cell.

When to scale:
Total disk available should be greater than 10-20% otherwise scale up
panels.title: Diego Cells - Total Disk Available %

alert.name: Diego Cells - Total Container Capacity Available % alert

panels.description:
Percentage of remaining container capacity for a given cell (regards to the number of containers a cell can host)

When to scale:
Total container capacity available should be greater than 10-20% otherwise scale up
panels.title: Diego Cells - Total Container Capacity Available %

panels.description: Total number of messages (envelopes) coming into the doppler servers

targets.legendFormat: Fog - Number of Messages Per Min
Sandbox - Number of Messages Per Min

panels.title: Firehose - Total Doppler Ingress

panels.description:
Represents the average rate of envelopes (messages) per Doppler instance. 

When to scale:
Average load on the Doppler instances should be <16,000 envelopes per second, or 1 million envelopes per minute.  Scale up Doppler when this threshold is reached.

targets.legendFormat: Fog - Avg Number of Doppler Messages
Sandbox - Avg Number of Doppler Messages

panels.title: Firehose - Doppler Message Rate

panels.description:
Metrics and logs enter the Firehose for transport and exit out of the platform through a consumer nozzle. If the consuming downstream system fails to keep up with the exiting stream of metrics, the Firehose is forced to close the connection to protect itself from back-pressure. The Firehose increments slow_consumer with each connection that it closes because a consumer could not keep up. This represents the change in number of drops.

When to scale:
Scale when the rate of Firehose Slow Consumer Drops is irregular for a given environment.
panels.title: Firehose - Slow Consumer Drops Delta

panels.description:
The loss rate occurring as messages are transported from the Loggregator Agent components through the Doppler components to the Firehose endpoints.

When to scale:
Should be less than 1%. Scale up the number of Traffic Controllers and Doppler instances when threshold is reached.

targets.legendFormat: Fog - Firehose Loss Rate Per Min
Fog - Firehose Loss Rate Per Hour
Sandbox - Firehose Loss Rate Per Min
Sandbox - Firehose Loss Rate Per Hour

panels.title: Firehose - Dropped Messages

panels.description:
The loss rate of the Syslog Adapters, that is, the total messages dropped as a percentage of the total traffic coming through the Syslog Adapters. Total messages include only logs for bound applications. 

When to scale:
Should be less than 1% otherwise performance test your syslog server, review the logs of the syslog consuming system for intake and other performance issues that indicate a need to scale the consuming system.

targets.legendFormat: Fog - Firehose Syslog Loss Rate Per Min
Sandbox - Firehose Syslog Loss Rate Per Min

panels.title: Firehose - Adatper Loss Rate

alert.name: Reverse Log Proxy - Avg Subscriptions alert

panels.description:
The Reverse Log Proxy (RLP) limits the number of subscriptions. A subscription is a consumer of the RLP so this metric concerns the number of concurrent consumer of an RLP instance. The maximum subscription count is 1000 per RLP.

When to scale:
When the number of subscriptions reaches or crosses, scale up the number of traffic controllers
panels.title: Reverse Log Proxy - Avg Subscriptions

alert.name: Reverse Log Proxy Loss Rate alert

panels.description:
The loss rate of the reverse log proxies (RLP), that is, the total messages dropped as a percentage of the total traffic coming through the reverse log proxy. Total messages include only logs for bound applications. 

When to scale:
Should be less than 1%. Scale up the number of traffic controllers when this threshold is reached

targets.legendFormat: Fog - Firehose Syslog Loss Rate Per Min
Sandbox - Firehose Syslog Loss Rate Per Min

panels.title: Reverse Log Proxy Loss Rate

panels.description:
CPU utilization for each Gorouter

When to scale:
CPU usage should be within a maximum range of 60-70% for the best Gorouter performance.
panels.title: Routing - VM CPU Utilization

panels.description:
CPU utilization for each UAA vm

When to scale:
CPU usage should be within a maximum range of 80-90% for the best UAA performance. .
panels.title: UAA - VM CPU Utilization

panels.description:
PAS internal NFS Server persistent disk usage 

When to scale:
Total usage should be below 75%
panels.title: NFS - Persistent Disk Usage %
